newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombia's CPI rose 1.03 pct in August.
newsitem.headline: Colombia's CPI rose 1.03 pct in August.

text.p: Colombia's Consumer Price Index rose a higher-than-expected 1.03 percent in August, the National Statistics Department (DANE) said.
As measured on an accumulated basis for the first eight months of the year, it said the index had now risen 16.96 percent, just under the central bank's 17 percent target for the entire year.
Real inflation this year is expected to exceed 21 percent, according to most independent estimates.
Inflation over the past 12 months stands at 21.05 percent according to the figures released by DANE. It gave no comparative figure for inflation between August 1994 and August 1995.
